pr_title: CB-6705: Register multiple cluster proxy service for FreeIPA HA

timeline.message:
CB-6705: Register multiple cluster proxy service for FreeIPA HA

Register one cluster proxy service for each FreeIPA instance and an
additional one for the primary gateway for use during provisioning.
Prefer using the primary gateway freeipa instance but if it is
offline, then pick an instance of freeipa that is working.
Use the instance specific cluster proxy connections for health status,
that way the health status doesn't require both the checked node and
primary gateway node to be online.

When reporting the health status for FreeIPA's UI status, report an
error if any instance is offline. That way there is an easy way for a
customer to know if manual repair operation is required. In the future
when the repair happens automatically, the status should only report a
failure when all nodes are offline.

In addition to the tests, this was manually tested by bringing
individual FreeIPA instances offline and validating the status is
reported correctly. FreeIPA management service operations were also
validated to work when a node was offline.

replies.author: jamisonbennett

timeline.bodyText: we could use StackEvent here so both the old and new event would match
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: The StackEvent is still used during the original bootstrapping for the StackProvisionFlowConfig. The ClusterProxyUpdateRegistrationSuccess is for the new step in the FreeIpaProvisionFlowConfig. The StackProvisionFlowConfig events remain unchanged. Does. it still make sense to have a StackEvent here? If so I will make the change.
replies.author: jamisonbennett

timeline.bodyText: nit: create a comparator class for this
timeline.author: lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: don't include repository anywhere else than the related service
timeline.author: lacikaaa
lacikaaa

timeline.bodyText: is it ok to add this ServiceConfig on bootstrap and again when we are adding the other ones? It looks like to me we double add it, and I don't know if it cause any issue on CP side
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: Yes, I confirmed this with the cluster proxy team. The registration is a "force" registration and it overwrites the old config.
replies.author: jamisonbennett

timeline.bodyText: protocol should come from GatewayConfig as it is used when we are building apiAddress
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: The gateway config is updated to use the protocol of cluster proxy. This needs to be the NGINX endpoint protocol not the protocol of cluster proxy. When registering an endpoint in cluster proxy the needs to be the final NGINX endpoint. I will rename the method to make this a little more clear.
replies.author: jamisonbennett

timeline.bodyText: is this still a valid option? can we receive such exceptions?
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: I noticed this yesterday too. You are correct, it is impossible to receive these exceptions. I am in the process of fixing this in CB-6745. I would prefer to fix this in a separate pull request since this wasn't affected by this pull request and this PR is pretty large already.
replies.author: jamisonbennett
